How many people are taking part in tree-planting?

M Mike

Mike is a citizen from SmallTown. He says he loves trees more and can't stand deforestation. More-so, he takes part in all community-based programs concerned in tree-planting.

'How I wish people could lucidly understand more than crystal that the environment you live in influences your health.' he says.

How the government influences environmental conservation

Law Enforcement

Laws concerning trees and the environment are passed from the legislative council and forwarded to the president for acceptance and signing.

The constitution is concerned with making the laws available for all citizens in a country. However, failing to abide by the laws concerning environmental conservation could be detrimental.

Public Awareness

Government officials are people involved in making sure that the law coincides with what the people are doing to conserve the environment.

There are various representatives for each county who make sure that all and sundry are involved in tree-planting activities and all other environmental conservative measures.

NGOs

The well-known term 'NGO' is an abbreviation for Non-Governmental Organizations. They are vital in the environment conservation sector.

Non-Governmental Organizations are the ones walking behind the scenes to help bring about environmental conservation mechanisms that have vast good influence to people and the environment. In so doing, they stand out in the public awareness sector.
